buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Early procurement of high-risk, long lead-time items
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Cooling tower (EVAPCO ATWB), DOAS (Trane), and VRF components (Mitsubishi) all have lead times exceeding 20 weeks and are critical to the project schedule.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Reduction of project schedule risk by 4-6 weeks, avoiding costly temporary solutions
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Issue early purchase orders for cooling tower, DOAS, and VRF equipment after expedited submittal review

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Multiple system types (hydronic, airside, VRF) with different manufacturers will require careful integration with the building automation system.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Reduction of commissioning duration by 2-3 weeks and minimization of change orders related to controls integration
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Schedule pre-submittal controls coordination meeting with all equipment vendors, controls contractor, and engineer

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Nine water-source heat pumps with similar configurations present an opportunity for prefabrication and standardized installation.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Labor savings of 15-20% on WSHP installation, improved quality control, and reduced field coordination issues
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Develop prefabrication drawings for WSHP installations including piping assemblies, supports, and connection details

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Several discrepancies noted in specification references, particularly for cooling tower, VRF, and pumps.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Elimination of RFIs and potential change orders related to unclear specifications
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Conduct comprehensive specification review and submit consolidated RFI for all identified gaps

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Complex project with multiple equipment types requires strategic approach to submittal process.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Streamlined approval process for critical path items, reducing overall procurement timeline by 2-3 weeks
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Develop tiered submittal schedule with priority for cooling tower, DOAS, VRF, and controls integration

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Mitsubishi VRF components have long lead times and relatively high cost compared to alternatives.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Potential cost savings of 5-10% on VRF components and possible lead time reduction of 2-4 weeks
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Evaluate Daikin or LG as alternative VRF suppliers, focusing on controls compatibility and performance specifications
